data.title: 2018 Black Book: 364 Executives to Know
data.meta_description: Welcome to the 21st annual Black Book from Hawaii Business Magazine – a valuable insight into who are the decision makers, movers and shakers of the state's business world.
data.text:
This list includes biographies from executives of the Top 250 companies and organizations in Hawaii (August issue). To diversify the list, we have included top honorees and executives from three major Hawaii Business programs:

20 for the Next 20 (March issue)

Best Places to Work (April issue)

The first 25 of the Top 100 in Real Estate (June issue)

Biography surveys were emailed to nearly 900 Hawaii executives in August. Of those, we received information to print 364 biographies. Information submitted was edited for conciseness, clarity and formatting, but in most cases we print it in it’s entirety.

CATEGORIES:

Construction & Development

Education

Energy

Finance

Healthcare

Insurance

Nonprofit

Real Estate

Retail/Wholesale Distribution

Tourism/Leisure

Transportation

+ Others

ABBREVIATION KEY:

Chair = Chairman of the Board

Pres. = President

CEO = Chief Executive Officer

COO = Chief Operating Officer

CFO = Chief Financial Officer

CIO = Chief Information Officer

CLO = Chief Lending Officer

Dir. = Director

Exec. Dir. = Executive Director

Exec. Mgr. = Executive Manager

EVP = Executive Vice President

GM = General Manager

Treas. = Treasurer

Sec. = Secretary

Sr. Exec. Dir. = Senior Exec. Dir

Sr. EVP = Senior Executive Vice President

Sr. VP = Senior Vice President

RVP = Regional Vice President

VP = Vice President

Mgr. = Manager

Mng. Dir. = Managing Director

Mng. Partner = Managing Partner

Reg. Dir. = Regional Director

Admin. = Administration

/ = of

Assn. = Association

BOD. = Board of Directors

CC = Country Club

Comm. = Committee

Corp. = Corporation

HBR = Hawaii Business Roundtable

HS = High School

Intl. = International

Org. = Organization

U = University

NTOES:

1) PRIOR EMPLOYMENT EXPERIENCE:

We have not always listed every past position or experience gained in detail. Some included the years they served in positions. We generally included this as much as possible.

2) Boards:

These include advisory, governance, directorial, corporate and community boards, associations, and business organizations that executives serve on.

3) CLUB MEMBERSHIP:

These include recreational clubs such as golf and country clubs, as well as business and community clubs.

4) ACCOMPLISHMENTS:

Includes awards, significant achievements, recognitions of service and various other milestones, generally professional in nature. In some cases we included only recent accomplishments.

5) NOTEWORTHY:

Includes personal achievements, interesting facts and more colorful details on executives’ backgrounds.

Information presented in this order

Name • Title and company • Top 250 company rank as of August 2017 ranking (if applicable) • Year of birth; birth city, state and/or country • Education: high school attended, state where high school is located and year graduated; university attended, degree and major, year graduated • Certifications • Military service • Prior employment experience • Corporate boards and community boards and associations • Club memberships • Hobbies • Social media • Spouse’s name, spouse’s employment, number of children • Achievements and special biographical notes

CONSTRUCTION

Guy Akasaki

Pres., CEO, Commercial Roofing & Waterproofing Hawaii, Inc. #211

B. Honolulu EDUC. Kubasaki HS, Okinawa UH; EXP. 40 yrs. of roofing and construction experience. Has vast knowledge of the roofing and waterproofing industry. Formed CRW in ‘93 during a recession and built the company to become successful. CRW is involved in sustainability initiatives as well. Akasaki is experienced in other fields: photovoltaic systems, tax credits and subsidies, and financing of PPA’s; development of design for non-glass photovoltaic modules for military; R&D funding opportunities to advance the field of renewable energy; utility firms; property acquisitions and management; and foreign investments. Launched CRWDIRECT service, a proactive approach for repairs, preventative maintenance, forecasting and budgeting. BDS. Hawaii Contractors Licensing Board, 3-term service; Grace Bible Honolulu; Children’s Discovery Center; The Salvation Army CLUBS Waialae CC ACCOMP. PBN Fastest Growing 50 Small Businesses; INC 500 and 5000 listing; Winner of PBN’s Best In Business Category 1 by Business Leadership Awards, ‘10; Ranked in the top RCAH Roofing Awards annually; Nominated for Family Business at the PBN BL Awards, ‘16; Awarded “Commercial Roofing Contractor of the Year 2014” nationwide by Roofing Contractor Magazine; Hawaii State Contractor License Board Chair for 8 yrs; CRW selected for the ‘18 Excellence in Safety Award for Small Construction Sub Contractor by the Hawaii Chapter of ASSP HOBBIES Surfing, SUP, reading, gym FAM. Lanette, 3 children NOTEWORTHY Specializes in new ventures, new opportunities, corporate structure, business consulting, international business, networking, strategic partnerships and sustainable initiatives related to energy and construction. Guy values giving back through mentorship and donations. HB HONORS Top 250 Exec

Emile Alano

VP, COO, AHL #190

B. 1961; San Francisco, CA EDUC. UC Berkeley, BA Environmental Design EXP. Licensed in both Hawaii and California. Joined AHL in ‘97, became senior associate in ‘00, and promoted to principal in ‘10 and COO in ‘15. He has 35 yrs. of extensive experience in retail, commercial, hospitality, residential, institutional and military architectural projects, including complex and technically challenging projects. He has been a part of projects such as Aulani, A Disney Resort & Spa, Walgreens Ke‘eaumoku Flagship Store, Marriott’s Ko Olina Beach Club, Hawai‘i Hall at the University of Hawaii and the Kapolei Police Station. BDS. AHL CLUBS American Institute of Architects; Urban Land Institute; Intl. Council of Shopping Centers; US Green Building Council; Hawaii Society of Business Professionals ACCOMP. 2016 Intl. Council of Shopping Centers Vision-Innovation-Value-Achievement Retail Store Design Award for Walgreens Keeaumoku Flagship Store. HOBBIES Spending time with family, traveling, tinkering around the house trying to fix things, sketching, and hiking FAM. Lisa Alano NOTEWORTHY Emile was an extra in two movies, one an old Wayne Wang movie and another with Jim Belushi. He also has a knack for winning door prizes at events, including a few big screen TVs, drones, sporting event tickets, and two-day Tesla test drives! HB HONORS Top 250 Exec
